results.title: Rice growing in New South Wales
results.creator_credit: New South Wales. Dept. of Education
results.brief_description: Introduces briefly the essential soil and rainfall requirements for rice growing in NSW. Shows the steps taken by the farmer to grow the rice, including fertilization, sowing, irrigation and harvesting of the crop.
results.description: Introduces briefly the essential soil and rainfall requirements for rice growing in NSW. Shows the steps taken by the farmer to grow the rice, including fertilization, sowing, irrigation and harvesting of the crop.

results.title: Wages and production
results.creator_credit: Arla Sorkin, Ilene Kahn, Terry Kahn Organization and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description:
Applies demand and supply principles to labour. Shows how wage rates affect the kinds and amounts of labour services offered and the amount demanded. Presents some factors affecting wage rates.
Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Supply
results.creator_credit: Terry Kahn, Arla Sorkin, Ilene Kahn and Terry Kahn Organization
results.brief_description: Shows how the amount of goods produced and supplied responds to market price and how anticipated sales, selling prices, costs and profits guide a potential producer.

results.title: The Fad diet circus
results.brief_description: Shows the potential hazards of fad diets, which seldom result in long-term weight loss. Compares two groups of dieters, one on a well balanced diet and the other on a low carbohydrate diet. Shows how both groups lose weight but the low carbohydrate group experiences medical problems.

results.title: A Man called Edison
results.creator_credit: Dennis R. Atkinson and Spectra Pictures
results.brief_description: Presents Thomas Edison’s contributions to the motion picture industry through his early kinetoscope films. Provides a vivid panorama of early moviemaking. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: What happens inside?
results.brief_description: Uses animation and live action to record growth of a fertilised mammal egg. The terms gestation, umbilicus and placenta are explained. Shows birth of a litter of kittens and compares mother’s care of kittens to that of humans. Describes the first four months of human foetal development. From the series “Family living and sex eduation”.

results.title: Puzzle children
results.creator_credit: Bill Davis, Stephen Beck and WQED
results.brief_description: Discusses learning disabilities in children and identifies some of the myths that prevent an accurate understanding of these problems. Profiles four children with specific learning handicaps. Including comments by their parents, teachers, and special educators. Hosted by Julie Andrews and Bill Bixby.

results.title: Wilderness: The Himalayas
results.creator_credit: Ned Kelly, British Broadcasting Corporation and Time-Life Films
results.brief_description: Narrator Anthony Smith journeys from India to Tibet along an ancient foot highway which unites the two countries. Highlights the fauna, flora and people en route. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Tuareg
results.brief_description: A six year drought in the Sahel desert has forced the Tuareg to abandon their traditional nomadic ways. The film examines the changes in the structure and lifestyle of the Tuareg and looks at Community Aid Abroad projects which are helping them to establish a new way of life.
